string_data:
PRIMARY: Two Just Stop Oil protesters, Morgan Trowland (40, structural engineer) and Marcus Decker (34, private tutor), scaled the Dartford Crossing bridge for almost 40 hours, causing gridlock traffic. They unfurled a giant Just Stop Oil banner and set up hammocks 200ft above the road. Trowland was jailed for three years and Decker for two years for public nuisance, with their Supreme Court appeal being refused.

SECONDARY: No secondary protest actions mentioned.

OTHER FOCAL: The article focuses on new legislation under the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act introducing harsher penalties for non-violent protest, with maximum sentences of 10 years. The disruption affected a pregnant woman needing medical help and caused over Â£160,000 in business losses.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral, factual tone while reporting on the legal proceedings and sentences.
